author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
Of Chinas boon in wine of tax so sweet,
For carriages electric, they promote,
A bounty fair, for four years shall it meet,
To guide the folk in this new path remote.

A tale, alas, of FTSE's woeful fall,
As housebuilders lament with bitter groan,
The rise of rates ignites a dreary pall,
The mortgage-held in darkness, left alone.

To gold's exalted state we turn our eyes,
Through years of turmoil and uncertain gales,
For when the Fed's rate-hiking path doth lie,
This precious shade shall shine o'er fleeting tales.

feedItems.title: China Rolls out $72 Billion in Tax Breaks for New-Energy Vehicles
feedItems.description: China unveiled a package of tax breaks aimed at boosting the purchase of electric vehicles over the next four years.

feedItems.title: FTSE 100 Falls as UK Inflation Data Fuel Rate-Rise Bets
feedItems.description: The FTSE 100 fell 0.4%, led by housebuilders, as the inflation data fuelled expectations about further BOE rate rises, which would add to the squeeze on mortgage holders and dampen demand in the property market, Interactive Investors said.

feedItems.title: Gold to Remain Elevated in 2023 and 2024 as Fed Nears End of Hiking Cycle
feedItems.description: Gold prices are likely to stay high through 2023 and into 2024, with a combination of global financial instability and with the Fed coming to the end of its interest-rate hiking cycle likely to bolster prices, Fitch said.

author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
Upon Sterling's sea, a tempest rose,
As Loki's whispers crept in foes,
Inflation's tide of numbers waned,
Yet interest harken'd unto gains.

Then blackened clouds sail o'er the oil,
Upon fierce waves where trade doth boil,
A twisted path where signals mixed,
In Europe's grasp, a tempest fix'd.

Of Euro bonds, far-reaching bough,
On Gilt yields gripped by upheaval's plow,
With voracious maw, now UK consumes,
As Fates with debts thus seal our dooms.

feedItems.title: Sterling Erases Initial Gains After UK Inflation Data
feedItems.description: Sterling erased its initial gains after the higher-than-expected U.K. inflation data, reflecting the market’s already aggressive interest-rate rise expectations for the BOE, ING said.

feedItems.title: Oil Edges Up Amid Mixed Signals
feedItems.description: Oil prices edged up in Europe, continuing a stretch of sideways trading as the market is caught between conflicting demand drivers.

feedItems.title: Eurozone Government Bond Yields Rise After UK Inflation Data
feedItems.description: Eurozone government bond yields rose, tracking sharp gains for gilt yields on the higher-than-expected U.K. inflation data, which makes further BOE rate increases more likely, feeding through into European bond moves.

author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
In depths below, a search so dire,
For missing sub, a sound doth ring.
Canadian craft, to find and tire,
Time runs short, for air is thin.

A price unchanged, yet high it stands,
In U.K.'s grasp, inflation steady,
The BOE, with firm command,
Must tame the rise, their plans be ready.

From May's embrace, new cars ascend,
In Europe's land, sales leap and bound.
Electric steeds, their share extend,
Yet still below, what once was found.

feedItems.title: Noises Detected in Hunt for Missing Titanic Submersible
feedItems.description: Canadian aircraft detected underwater noises in the search for a missing submersible, the U.S. Coast Guard said, as the clock ticks down in the race to find the crew before their air supply runs out.

feedItems.title: UK Inflation Unexpectedly Holds Steady
feedItems.description: Consumer prices in the U.K. were 8.7% higher in May, unchanged from April but above expectations, while core prices also rose, a troubling development for the BOE in its efforts to curb inflation.

feedItems.title: Europe New Car Sales Jump in May
feedItems.description: New car registrations in Europe rose 18.5% from last May, with battery-electric vehicles taking a bigger market share, but total year-to-date sales remained 23% lower than pre-pandemic levels.

author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
In sky-bound chariots, divesting with haste,
Lufthansa bequeaths its payments to grace.
AirPlus thou leavest at SEB's door,
€450 million, a fortune to hoard.

The steward of SoftBank, Son of the Sun,
Devoting himself, where visions begun.
Amidst tears of hope yet, the AI revolution,
His life's creed anew, seeking the grandest solution.

Beneath cold waters, where Titanic lies,
A quest unforeseen, for time shall defy.
Five souls adrift in a submersible lost,
Rescue crews race, a mighty tempest they cross.

feedItems.title: Lufthansa Divests Payments Business
feedItems.description: Lufthansa has agreed to sell its payments specialist AirPlus to SEB for €450 million and said it expected the deal to have a positive effect on its adjusted operating margin and return on capital.

feedItems.title: Masayoshi Son Wants SoftBank to Lead the AI Revolution
feedItems.description: The CEO said he was devoting himself to artificial intelligence and new inventions after what he described as a tear-filled rethinking of his life’s mission.

feedItems.title: Rescue Crews Race Against Time to Locate Missing Titanic Sub
feedItems.description: U.S. and Canadian ships and planes worked to try to locate a missing submersible carrying five people that disappeared days earlier on a mission to see the deep-sea remains of the Titanic shipwreck.
